nameEntry.part: United States. John F. Kennedy Library

biogHist.p: Designed by I.M. Pei, the nation's official memorial to President Kennedy officially opened on October 20, 1979 at a ceremony attended by President Jimmy Carter and members of President Kennedy's family.
biogHist.citation: From the description of General information by and about the proposed site of the John F. Kennedy Library. (Harvard University). WorldCat record id: 77066297

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Harvard University. Photographs on naming of director of the John F. Kennedy Library, 1972.

did.unittitle: Photographs on naming of director of the John F. Kennedy Library, 1972.
did.abstract: Consists of photographs taken at the time that Dan Fenn was named the Director of the Kennedy Library, spring of 1972. Included in an archival category entitled Chronological miscellany, which consists of materials relating to or created by the Corporation, organized by date.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Massachusetts. Governor's Press Office. Photographs, 1909-2003.

did.unittitle: Photographs, 1909-2003.

physdesc.extent: 25.03 cubic ft. (videocassette, photographs and photographs : negative in 15 record center cartons, 10 doc. boxes, 16 boxes, and 1 v.)Logs 1.25 cubic ft. (1 record center carton)

did.abstract: The Governor's Press Office is responsible for publicizing events of the governor's administration. In fulfilling this function, it maintains photodocumentation of such events, particularly those directly involving the governor, and releases photographs to the media.

Leahy (1968-1972 assistant;1972-80 Associate Dean for Resources and Planning; and 1980- Associate Dean for Research and Allied Institutions). For more detailed information about records, see Harvard Archives LOCATION below.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Harvard University. Vice President for Government and Community Affairs. Records of Donald Moulton, Assistant Vice-President for Community Affairs, 1970-1978 (inclusive).

origination.persname: Harvard University. Vice President for Government and Community Affairs.

did.unittitle: Records of Donald Moulton, Assistant Vice-President for Community Affairs, 1970-1978 (inclusive).
did.abstract: Records of Assistant Vice-President Donald Moulton, including correspondence, memoranda, and reports relating to various civic organizations in the Cambridge area. Primary topics include land acquisition and use, Harvard Square development, Kennedy Library development, the Medical Area Total Energy Plant, Roxbury Tenants of Harvard, payments in lieu of taxes, and the Cambridge Corporation. Some files of Lewis Armistead, an assistant to the Vice-President for Government and Community Affairs, are included.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Harvard University. Vice President for Government and Community Affairs. Correspondence and other records of Charles Daly, 1971-1976 (inclusive).

origination.persname: Harvard University. Vice President for Government and Community Affairs.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and other records of Charles Daly, 1971-1976 (inclusive).
did.abstract: Records of Vice-President Charles Daly, including correspondence, memoranda, and reports, relating to matters such as Dumbarton Oaks, housing, and the Kennedy Library. Also included are files of the Government Information Office (an office under the Office of Government and Community Affairs to provide information to faculty members on available federal and state research support).

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Thomas G. Paterson Papers., 1836-2002.

did.unittitle: Thomas G. Paterson Papers. 1836-2002.
did.abstract: Thomas Graham Paterson received his Bachelors degree from the University of New Hampshire in 1963, and his Masters and Doctoral degrees from the University of California, Berkeley in 1964 and 1968, respectively. As an historian, educator, and author, he has written and co-written a number of books and articles, and has also acted as an editor for various other publications. Paterson is known primarily for his contributions to the history of the Cold War with a focus on Cuba, as well as United States foreign relations in general.
